answer:
In BC, children who start a Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Vaccine series when they are in grade 6 (or ages 9 to 14 years only) need 2 doses given at least 6 months apart.  If your daughter had 2 doses of HPV vaccine at least 6 months apart, her HPV vaccine series is complete and she does not require any further doses. If you have questions about the timing of your daughter's vaccines, contact your local health unit. Use the health unit finder.
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## In BC, children who start a Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Vaccine series when they are in grade 6 (or ages 9 to 14 years only) need 2 doses given at least 6 months apart.


## If your daughter had 2 doses of HPV vaccine at least 6 months apart, her HPV vaccine series is complete and she does not require any further doses.

If you have questions about the timing of your daughter's vaccines, contact your local health unit.
Use the health unit finder.
Immunization Nurse
question: My daughter got 2 shot of HPV in 2014 when she was in grade 6. She didn't get the third shot from the school nurse last year. Where can she get the third shot to finish the whole series?
question_variation_0: where can a child with HPV get the third shot
question_variation_2: where can i get a third shot of HPV to finish the whole series
